summary: The document is an interview report detailing the retirement of Charlotte Bustos-Videla from the CIA on December 30, 1977, conducted under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act. It emphasizes the security protocols, confidentiality agreements, and the proprietary nature of information handled by the CIA. The report advises on the importance of adhering to security regulations, including the prohibition of sharing sensitive information with individuals from other government agencies, regardless of their clearance levels. Post-retirement, the subject was instructed to contact the agency for any security-related queries.
key_findings: The interview was conducted under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act.
Charlotte Bustos-Videla was a GS-14 level employee at the CIA.
The document details the security measures and confidentiality agreements applicable to CIA employees.
It highlights the prohibition of sharing intelligence operations, sources, and methods with other government agencies.
The subject was instructed to contact the agency for any security-related queries post-retirement.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
